contentList.content: A ring made to defy the gods.

Breathe shadowy flames in a cone, dealing [1], applying Soul Burn, and leaving a cursed fire surface behind.
Damage increases for every percentage of vitality you are missing.

Reap the battlefield, dealing [1] to enemies in an arc.
Slaying enemies grants [Key:LLWEAPONEX_SOULHARVEST_DAMAGE_BONUS_APPLY_DisplayName] (a stacking damage bonus), and restores source points.

Channel a torrent of water through your hand, setting Wet on targets hit for 2 turns, and dousing burning surfaces.
If a Burning Ally is Doused, Mending is applied for 1 turn.
Mending restores [1] and does not damage the Undead.
Allies hit are cleansed of Slowed and Enwebbed.
You have to love that cheery jingle-jangle as you walk...
A mastery scroll. Meet the mastery requirement to unlock the scroll and learn the secrets within.
While Warfare skills are typically for warriors, specialized mages have bridged the gap via intense close combat training. Read this book to learn this skill.
Hydrosophist skills are Water-based magic spells. High intelligence improves these skills. Read this book to learn this skill.
Heavy and clunky, these platemail gloves would deliver quite the painful uppercut.
Somehow, it's even heavier than it looks.
They might not be as comfortable as house slippers, but if you step on a nail? You won't even notice.
Heavy as a bag of rocks, these platemail pants may chafe a little but they'll undoubtedly protect your modesty.
If you polish it up a little, this platemail armour could double as a mirror.

A prototype weapon capable of firing dense lead pellets at dangerous velocities.
Fits onto your belt.
A handmade quiver. Comfortably fits arrows of both normal size and greater.
An small crossbow with a wrist strap and easy-to-reach trigger. Fits comfortably on your arm.

The product of Dwarven technology and mysticism, this cannon fits snugly on your arm.
Powered by runes, the Runic Cannon is capable of harnessing magic at level once thought to be impossible without Source.
A backpack designed for any would-be demolitionist. Houses a plethora of unexploded ordinance.

An old blindfold, said to once belong to a monk in a distance land.
By choosing to cloak the perceived world in darkness, the monk found her inner strength grow.
A gauntlet once worn by a notorious demon. Seems to occasionally twitch.
A lethal, covert weapon created for one purpose: murder. Features a compact design, quiet mechanism, and deadly precision.
A hardy pair of gloves designed for forcefully taking treasure.
A rare set of dwarven gloves, said to grant the bearer enourmous strength.

Special tattoos that grant the bearer tremendous strength.
The tattoos glow a fierce red.
Special tattoos that grant the bearer tremendous strength.
An empty glass flask, perfect for housing liquid you'd like to relocate.
While the surface of this ball is hard, one good toss will unleash the contents upon an area.

A pouch that contains an assortment of special tokens, used to modify unique equipment.
Limit 1 bag per party.

A secret cache used by smugglers to store hidden goods.
Don't ask where it was hidden.

A strange token.
Combine this with specific unique weapons to change their scaling attribute.

A strange token.
Combine this with specific unique weapons to change their scaling attribute.

A strange token.
Combine this with specific unique weapons to change their scaling attribute.

A strange token.
Combine this with specific unique weapons to change their scaling attribute.

A strange token.
Combine this with specific unique weapons to change their scaling attribute.

A strange token.
Combine this with specific unique weapons to change their scaling attribute.

A strange token.
Combine this with specific unique weapons to change their scaling attribute.

The shard of a spent attribute token.
Combine three to create a new token.

A set of small bolts, specially-designed for an arm-mounted crossbow.
These bolts are electrified, dealing Air damage.

A set of small bolts, specially-designed for an arm-mounted crossbow.
These bolts are covered in a corrosive liquid, destroying Physical Armor on hit.

A set of small bolts, specially-designed for an arm-mounted crossbow.
These bolts are covered in oil, dealing Earth damage.

A set of small bolts, specially-designed for an arm-mounted crossbow.
These bolts are covered in a flammable substance, dealing Fire damage when ignited.

A set of small bolts, specially-designed for an arm-mounted crossbow.
These bolts are specially designed to penetrate armor.

A set of small bolts, specially-designed for an arm-mounted crossbow.
These bolts are covered in a deadly toxin, dealing Poison damage.

A set of small bolts, specially-designed for an arm-mounted crossbow.
These bolts are covered in a dark liquid that deals Shadow damage.

A set of small silver-tipped bolts, specially-designed for an arm-mounted crossbow.
Monsters such as Werebeasts, Demons, and the Undead are rumored to be suspectible to silver.

A set of small bolts, specially-designed for an arm-mounted crossbow.
These bolts are covered in a chilling frost, dealing Water damage on hit.

A bag of prototype bullets, coated in a special substance.
Magically, the bag seems to never run out of ammo.
These bullets release electrical energy on hit, dealing air damage.

A bag of prototype bullets, coated in a special substance.
Magically, the bag seems to never run out of ammo.
These bullets are covered in an armor-eating acid, dealing corrosive damage.

A bag of prototype bullets, coated in a special substance.
Magically, the bag seems to never run out of ammo.
These bullets are covered in a sticky tar, dealing earth damage.

A bag of prototype bullets, coated in a special substance.
Magically, the bag seems to never run out of ammo.
These bullets are like mini-grenades, exploding with fire damage on hit.

A bag of prototype bullets, coated in a special substance.
Magically, the bag seems to never run out of ammo.
These bullets release a freezing gas, dealing water damage on hit.

A bag of prototype bullets, coated in a special substance.
Magically, the bag seems to never run out of ammo.
These bullets are coated in a deadly toxin, dealing poison damage.

A bag of prototype bullets, coated in a special substance.
Magically, the bag seems to never run out of ammo.
These bullets are covered in a dark, etheral energy that deals shadow damage.

A bag of prototype Silver bullets.
Magically, the bag seems to never run out of ammo.
Monsters such as Werebeasts, Demons, and the Undead are rumored to be suspectible to silver.
A small rune that when fitted inside a <font color='#40E0D0'>Runeblade</font>, allows the wielder to activate that element within their blade for a limited time.
A small rune that when fitted inside a <font color='#40E0D0'>Runeblade</font>, allows the wielder to absorb elements in their surroundings and activate them their blade for a limited time.
A small rune that when fitted inside a <font color='#40E0D0'>Runeblade</font>, allows the wielder to activate that element within their blade for a limited time.
A small rune that when fitted inside a <font color='#40E0D0'>Runeblade</font>, allows the wielder to activate that element within their blade for a limited time.
A small rune that when fitted inside a <font color='#40E0D0'>Runeblade</font>, allows the wielder to activate that element within their blade for a limited time.
A small rune that when fitted inside a <font color='#40E0D0'>Runeblade</font>, allows the wielder to activate that element within their blade for a limited time.

A special pet rock. This little guy always has your back.
Can be continually thrown until Kevin gets tired.
Kevin will recharge 1 energy per turn.

A weight throwing axe.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A large, weight axe.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A... Bow?
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A simple stool.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A... Crossbow?
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A dagger designed for throwing.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A weighty hammer. Prfect for knocking people out.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A big paddle.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A rock perfectly suited for throwing.
Throw it at an enemy's head!

A large scythe.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A shield designed for throwing.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

An extremely sharp, star-shaped plate of metal.
Looks perfect for throwng!

An extremely sharp, star-shaped plate of metal.
Looks perfect for throwng!

A sickle designed for throwing.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A spear designed for throwing.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A big staff.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A sword designed for throwing.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A large two-handed sword, obviously not designed for throwing.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A wand best used as a projectile.
Looks useless as a weapon.
Throw it at an enemy instead!

A special pet rock. This little guy always has your back.
Kevin is exausted, and must recharge fully before he can be thrown again.

A special pet rock, covered in nails with some sort of adhesive. This little guy always has your back.
Can be continually thrown until Kevin gets tired.
Kevin will recharge 1 energy per turn.

A special pet rock. This little guy always has your back.
Can be continually thrown until Kevin gets tired.
Kevin will recharge 1 energy per turn.

A special pet rock, dipped in oil. This little guy always has your back.
Can be continually thrown until Kevin gets tired.
Kevin will recharge 1 energy per turn.

A special pet rock, dipped in poison. This little guy always has your back.
Can be continually thrown until Kevin gets tired.
Kevin will recharge 1 energy per turn.

A special hammer, imbued with magic, that allows one to temper a sword into a Runeblade.
Tempered Runeblades cannot be reversed!
Fired like a prayer, this blessed water arrow might be just the divine intervention you need in a hot situation.
This cute little arrow infused with a charming potion is quite something. You really, really, really like it.
A fire arrow that is hot to the touch. You probably want to keep it safely away from oils and suchlike.
A cursed arrow that lands like a witch's kiss, draining the fervour of any foe.
Known as 'Arrow of the Dragon' to the renowned Lapiterran archers, this explosive projectile will just as soon blow up in your face as at your enemy's feet.
A frost-capped arrow that bites deep and stops targets in their tracks.
A lead-weight arrow that's almost too heavy to fire. Almost.
Look closely; the only visible difference between this arrow and a normal arrow can be seen in the sizzling dents within the tip of the arrowhead.
A sharp arrow shimmering beneath a toxic green mist; best not to inhale as you release this venomous cloud.
This arrow is sure to slow your foes in their tracks as well as put a spring in your step.
An occluding arrow was made from a recipe stolen from the chronicles of the Kallavi, an elusive troupe of burglars.
Wreathed in sparking energy, this arrow can unleash a tempest upon its unlucky target.
A hissing arrow packed tight with steam. This baby is ready to explode; shield your eyes as you nock and load.
An arrow infused with the fury of the air. If you listen closely you can hear it whistle and seethe with anticipation.
The artistry is all in the cunning way you affix the flask of water to the arrow. Or so you've been told.
A scholar's dearest weapon. Beat them down with KNOWLEDGE!
A scholar's dearest weapon. Beat them down with KNOWLEDGE!
A scholar's dearest weapon. Beat them down with KNOWLEDGE!
A scholar's dearest weapon. Beat them down with KNOWLEDGE!
A scholar's dearest weapon. Beat them down with KNOWLEDGE!
A scholar's dearest weapon. Beat them down with KNOWLEDGE!
A pair of shields that are used together. Rare Black Ring soldiers once wielded these wicked shields, gutting foes upon their sharp edges.
Surprisingly, for those looking to draw their foes' ire, a target makes for a worthy shield.
A well-crafted mainhand shield for a set of intricate dual shields. A dwarven craftsman must have hammered this pair of shields into perfection.
A sturdy set of wooden shields. Aged longer than most non-elvish lifespans, these shields have seen civilizations rise and fall.
Designed for melee mayhem, this spear will pierce your enemies a lot deeper than your witty arguments.
A product of technological innovation, this intricate armament is capable of ejecting metal pellets at high velocities.

A product of technological innovation, this intricate armament is capable of ejecting metal pellets at high velocities.
This rifle is slightly more suited to long-range sharpshooters.
A greatbow arrow with a razor-sharp edge.
Fired like a prayer, this blessed water greatbow arrow might be just the divine intervention you need in a hot situation.
This cute little greatbow arrow infused with a charming potion is quite something. You really, really, really like it.
A fire greatbow arrow that is hot to the touch. You probably want to keep it safely away from oils and suchlike.
A cursed greatbow arrow that lands like a witch's kiss, draining the fervour of any foe.
Known as 'Arrow of the Dragon Slayer' to the renowned Lapiterran archers, this explosive projectile will just as soon blow up in your face as at your enemy's feet.
A frost-capped greatbow arrow that bites deep and stops targets in their tracks.
A lead-weight greatbow arrow that's almost too heavy to fire. Almost.
Look closely; the only visible difference between this greatbow arrow and a normal greatbow arrow can be seen in the sizzling dents within the tip of the arrowhead.
A sharp greatbow arrow shimmering beneath a toxic green mist; best not to inhale as you release this venomous cloud.
A greatbow arrow covered in acid that eats away at armor. Miraculously, it failed to degrade your quiver.
This greatbow arrow is sure to slow your foes in their tracks as well as put a spring in your step.
An occluding greatbow arrow was made from a recipe stolen from the chronicles of the Kallavi, an elusive troupe of burglars.
Wreathed in sparking energy, this greatbow arrow can unleash a tempest upon its unlucky target.
A hissing greatbow arrow packed tight with steam. This baby is ready to explode; shield your eyes as you nock and load.
An greatbow arrow infused with the fury of the air. If you listen closely you can hear it whistle and seethe with anticipation.
The artistry is all in the cunning way you affix the flask of water to the greatbow arrow. Or so you've been told.
A greatbow said to fire arrows so large that they shatter both men and mountains alike.
A greatbow enhanced with modern technological advances. Still requires great strength to wield.
A military-issue greatbow, crafted for a long-forgotten regiment said to have hunted flying magical beasts.
A high quality greatbow, crafted by an master artisan. This artifact is said to have slain dragons.
A blade forged in a nation far to the east. Cuts through flesh and bone with ease.
A large, long blade forged in a nation far to the east. Requires considerable strength to wield.
An old pipe. Functions as a makeshift quarterstaff.
A heavy staff with a tough grip. Functions as a balanced offensive and defensive weapon.
A sturdy staff with a balanced weight. Functions as both a walking stick, and a tool to bash skulls.
A sturdy wooden staff with a heavy, metal end. A balanced weapon with a respectable reach.
A lightweight blade with a razor-sharp point. Perfect for those who wish to dance along the battlefield.
A lightweight blade with a razor-sharp point. Perfect for those who wish to dance along the battlefield.
An explosive mine modified for remote detonation.<br.Handle with care!
An explosive mine modified for remote detonation.<br.Handle with care!
An explosive mine modified for remote detonation.<br.Handle with care!
An explosive mine modified for remote detonation.<br.Handle with care!
An explosive mine modified for remote detonation.<br.Handle with care!
An explosive mine modified for remote detonation.<br.Handle with care!
The important thing is the magic in your soul, not the wand itself. Just keep telling yourself that.
A Dwarven wand crafted from Driftwood timber and bound with thongs of Arxian leather.
An Elven wand carved from fallen timber and bound with living vines.
A wand assembled from myriad splinters and braided with bull leather.
Fiery-bright as the sun itself, this wand is almost too hot to the touch.
Forged from the hot sands of the Ancient Empire, and then baked beneath an unforgiving sun, this wand bears the heat of its birth deep within.
A magical blade imbued with the power of lightning. The runes can be invoked to bathe the blade in dangerous electrical energy.
A magical blade imbued with the power of lightning. The runes can be invoked to bathe the blade in dangerous electrical energy.
A fierce magical blade with no clear element defined. The runes can be invoked to absorb elemental power from the environment.
A magical blade imbued with the power of water. The runes can be invoked to bathe the blade in a dousing layer of water.
A magical blade imbued with the power of the earth. The runes can be invoked to bathe the blade in a impenetrable hardened surface.
A magical blade imbued with the power of fire. The runes can be invoked to bathe the blade in intense flame.
An inert Runeblade imbued with no specific element. Can crafted to give the blade magic once more.
A magical blade imbued with the power of poison. The runes can be invoked to bathe the blade in a deadly sludge.
A magical blade imbued with the power of water. The runes can be invoked to bathe the blade in a dousing layer of water.
A set of dark dual shields. Their vicious design reflect the Black Ring well.
A pair of two shields, designed to be used with both arms. For those who truly want to become an unstoppable wall.
A set of intricate dwarven shields. Sturdy and true.
Two solid wooden shields, paired together for expert use. While these elven designs may eschew metal, the ancient tree from which they were formed provides elegant magical resistance.
A knightly pair of shields, used by those of the highest calling that value protection of allies above all else.
A regal pair of shields, adorned with the insignia of the Empire. Common sense may dictate shields such as these are too ceremonial for battle, yet behind their beauty lies a fierce metallic will.
A razor-sharp, concealable blade of foreign design.

The end of the Runic Cannon glimmers like a dazzling gem, powered by runic magic.
Unequipping this requires detaching the safeties near your arm.

A book by a private group known as "Lionheart Medical", detailing the complex anatomical structure of various species, including the four common races, and beasts beyond. Studying this book affords a specialist's knowledge on how better to apply healing techniques.

The holiest of bibles, this is a sacred relic to the Divine Order of Lucian.
While a typical priest would use this book for sermons, a more apt warrior may put its size to good use as a bludgeoning weapon.
A scholar's dearest weapon. Beat them down with KNOWLEDGE!

An oversized scroll that once belonged to an ogre.
Despite having no talent for magic, Gnak was worshipped by his kind as an all-powerful Ogre Magi.
A wooden sword typically used for training.
A wooden sword typically used for training.
A magical blade, said to be possessed by a soul from the Void.
A portable cannon (otherwise known as a blunderbuss) capable of discharging firey bursts of lead.

A legendary greatbow that once belonged to the hero known as the God of Thunder.
Strikes enemies down with the power of the heavens.
The personal axe of Balrin, a Dwarven Berserker known for his legendary axe throwing.
A legendary cursed blade, said to have absorbed the hatred of its victims.
An ancient blade forged from runic metal, and tempered with the fire of a legendary elemental.
An anvil attached to a handle. As simple as that.
A magical staff said to be able to extend to great lengths. Once wielded by a warrior of legend.
A rare estoc forged from <font color='#40E0D0'>runic</font> metal. This blade pierces hearts with a bitter chlll.
A mysterious Runeblade said to harness the power of Chaos.
A wicked scythe once wielded by an infamous reaper. At night, you swear you can hear the skull quietly chattering...
A deadly scythe once belonging to the being known as "The Harvester", said to have reaped countless souls in an unending thirst for power.
A pair of two shields, designed to be used with both arms. For those who truly want to become an unstoppable wall.

A holy banner of the Divine Order, said to inspire all with its divine glory. While wielding the emblem of your captors is questionable, something about this banner stirs up a desire for leadership and teamwork.
A banner of the Lone Wolves, the infamous mercenary company. Inspire allies through a fierce pack mentality.

A beautifully-intricate sword gifted to a village for its heroic actions in The Great War. Despite being long enough for a two-handed class weapon, the blade is remarkably light, allowing fluid movement with one hand. When striking evil, the blade is said to engulf in flame, the words etched upon it granting power beyond the norm.
An imposing, heavy slab of metal, crafted from a mysterious alloy. A single eye, embedded in the hilt pulsates ever so slighly.
An ethereal blade, flickering ever so slightly. Said to have once belonged to a merciless wraith who eagerly persued its prey.

Rally the party at the target location.
Party members are granted a one-time use skill that teleports them to the raised banner.

Rally the party at the target location.
Party members are granted a one-time use skill that teleports them to the raised banner.
The banner inspires faith in the Divine, granting a +[1] boost to attributes, a +[2]% boost to dodge, and a +[3]% boost to damage.

Rally the party at the target location.
Party members are granted a one-time use skill that teleports them to the raised banner.
The banner unleashes the hunger of the pack, granting [1]% lifesteal and a [2]% boost to damage.
Character is being covered by a nearby ally.

Character has activated the Air Rune within their Runeblade.
Enemies hit have a 10% chance to become Shocked for 1 turn.
Wet increases this chance to 50%.

Water Rune + Earth Rune
Enemies hit have a 40% chance to be encased in Snow, lowering AP Recovery/Start by [1], Movement Speed by [2]%, and dealing Water Damage with a chance to fall down when moving.
Adds Water Damage and Earth Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Blood Rune + Air Rune
Melee attacks restore Vitality to allies within [1]m.
Adds Piercing Damage and Air Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Character has absorbed <font color='#8B0000'>Blood</font> after activating the <font color='#b823cb'>Chaos Rune</font> within their <font color='#40E0D0'>Runeblade</font>. 20% chance to apply <font color='#FF0000'>Bleeding</font> to enemies hit for 1 turn (Resisted by Magic Armor).

Blood Rune + Earth Rune
Deals additional damage when attacking Undead, with a 10% chance to Entangle enemies hit for 1 turn.
Entangle's chance is increased to 50% when attacking the Undead.
Adds Piercing Damage and Earth Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Blood Rune + Fire Rune
Enemies attacked with a Runeblade are inflicted with Soul Burn, taking damage on apply and turn, and lowering Elemental Resistance by 5% per stack (5 max).
Adds Piercing Damage and Fire Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Blood Rune x 2
Every third basic attack grants a Congealed Blood Ball, which can be thrown to create a blood surface.

Blood Rune + Poison Rune
40% chance to apply Infectious Disease on enemies hit for 1 turn.
Adds Piercing Damage and Poison Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Blood Rune + Water Rune
Regenerates Vitality on application and turn.
Adds Piercing Damage and Water Damage to weapon attacks and skills.
Character has activated the <font color='#b823cb'>Chaos Rune</font> within their <font color='#40E0D0'>Runeblade</font>, and is absorbing an element in the environment.

Water Rune + Air Rune
Applies Shocked to Wet enemies for 1 turn, otherwise Wet is applied for 1 turn.
Attacking a Shocked or Stunned enemy sends out a jolt of electricity to other enemies within 8m.
When Shocked is applied, that enemy gets Shock Resistance, preventing Shocked from being applied by Runeblades for 3 turns.
Adds Water Damage and Air Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Water Rune + Poison Rune
If an attacked target is Poisoned, the poison spreads to nearby enemies within [1]m.
If the enemies the poison spreads to are already Poisoned, the contamination continues.
Adds Water Damage and Poison Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Character has activated the Death Rune from absorbing Deathfog.
Enemies hit with a Runeblade are marked with Death Sentence for 1 turn, and cannot be marked again for 4 turns.
When an enemy with Death Sentence dies, they return as a friendly Revenant for 2 turns.
Revenants do 50% less damage, and cannot be created from bosses.

Earth Rune + Air Rune
30% chance on hit to shoot out a cone of dust in a 7m range, applying Blinded to enemies for 1 turn and dealing minor Earth Damage.
Dust Blast can only occur once per turn.
Adds Earth Damage and Air Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Character has activated the Earth Rune within their Runeblade.
Enemies hit have a 20% chance to be Slowed for 1 turn.

Fire Rune + Poison Rune
40% chance to cause a Mini-Explosion on attack, dealing Fire Damage in a 2m range.
Adds Fire Damage and Poison Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Character has activated the Fire Rune within their Runeblade.
Applies Burning to enemies hit for 1 turn.

Poison Rune + Air Rune
On attack, 50% chance to spawn or expand a Gas Cloud on the target (once per turn).
Adds Poison Damage and Air Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Fire Rune + Air Rune
If an attacked target is Burning, a heatburst burns enemies within [1]m.
If a heatburst target is already Burning, the heatburst continues.
Adds Fire Damage and Air Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Water Rune x 2
Applies Chilled to enemies hit for 1 turn. Enemies already Chilled have a 20% chance to become Frozen.

Fire Rune x 2
Applies Burning to enemies hit for 1 turns, or extends the duration of Burning by 1 turn per attack (4 turns max).

Fire Rune + Earth Rune
Enemies hit have a 60% chance to be bombarded with Lava, dealing Fire Damage, forking up to [1] times, and creating fire surfaces.
Adds Fire Damage and Earth Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Character has activated the Poison Rune within their Runeblade.
Applies Poisoned to enemies hit for 1 turn.

Earth Rune x 2
Enemies hit have a 20% chance to be [Key:LLWEAPONEX_MAGIC_KNOCKDOWN_CHECK_DisplayName] for 1 turn.
[Key:LLWEAPONEX_MAGIC_KNOCKDOWN_CHECK_DisplayName] is a magic-based knockdown.

Water Rune + Fire Rune
Enemies hit have a 40% chance to get a Water Burn for 2 turns, dealing Water + Fire Damage per turn.
Wet enemies have their moisture Evaporated, dealing damage and removing Wet.
Adds Water Damage and Fire Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Earth Rune + Poison Rune
Enemies hit have a 40% chance to be encased in Tar makes Burning bypass armor checks.
Adds Earth Damage and Poison Damage to weapon attacks and skills.

Air Rune x 2
Enemies hit have a 20% chance to be struck by a Thunderbolt, dealing Air Damage and chaining Lightning to enemies within 8m.
Wet increases this chance to 80%.Enemies can only be struck once per turn.

Poison Rune x 2
Applies Poisoned to enemies hit for 1 turn, or increases the duration of Poisoned by 1 turn per attack (4 turns max).

Character has activated the Water Rune within their Runeblade.
Applies Wet to enemies hit for 1 turn.
Earthsplitter - Attack the ground for 80% damage in a 2m radius
The <font color='#c5a65a'>Runic Cannon</font> is charged and ready to disperse stored energy.
Deals Shadow Damage to broken Magic Armour.

The [Key:ARM_UNIQUE_LLWEAPONEX_ArmCannon_A_DisplayName] normally only works with an empty hand or shield. Disabling this allows you to dual-wield it with regular weapons, but this may not be as balanced.
Perpetual Growth - This item automatically levels up
Enable automatically unlocking certain Weapon Expansion recipes when requirements are met, such as shuriken recipes as Throwing Mastery rank 1.
<icon id='Target_CripplingBlow'/>[Key:Target_CripplingBlow_DisplayName] deals additional <font color='#CD1F1F'>piercing damage</font> to disabled targets.

<icon id='MultiStrike_BlinkStrike;LLWEAPONEX_MASTERYBONUS_VULNERABLE' type='1;2'/>[Key:MultiStrike_BlinkStrike_DisplayName] applies [Key:LLWEAPONEX_MASTERYBONUS_VULNERABLE_DisplayName] to targets hit. [Key:LLWEAPONEX_MASTERYBONUS_VULNERABLE_DisplayName] lasts until the end of your turn, and deals a one-time amount of bonus damage on hit.<icon id='LLWEAPONEX_MasteryBonus_Axe_Savage_DisplayName,LLWEAPONEX_MB_Axe_Savage' type='3'/>[Key:LLWEAPONEX_MB_Axe_Savage]
<icon id='Shout_Whirlwind'/>Keep spinning when using [Key:Shout_Whirlwind_DisplayName], dealing reduced damage per spin.

<icon id='Target_Flurry'/>Each hit with [Key:Target_Flurry_DisplayName] cleaves in a small cone.<icon id='LLWEAPONEX_MasteryBonus_Axe_Stalker_DisplayName,LLWEAPONEX_MB_Axe_Stalker' type='3'/>[Key:LLWEAPONEX_MB_Axe_Stalker]
Character deals bonus damage with grenades, and has a chance to sabotage enemies with explosions.
Gain Detonation Skill and Enhanced Demolition

Character has thrown Balrin's Throwing Axe at a target.
Get near the target to retrieve the axe, otherwise it will return when this status ends.
Character is rallying the party to battle.
Character is inspired by the <font color='#c5a65a'>Banner of Unruly Faith</font>. How glorious!
